Greetings to Tunisian President 
    Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Mar. 19 sent a message of greetings to Zine el Abidine Ben Ali, president of Tunisia, on the national day of the country.
 The president in the message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the interests of the two peoples and sincerely wished the Tunisian president greater successes in his work to build a developed and prosperous new society.

articles.content:
Greetings to Namibian President
    Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to Namibian President Hifikepunye Pohamba on the occasion of the 15th anniversary of the Independence of Namibia.
 Referring to the fact that the diligent Namibian people have achieved many successes in the work for the stability and development of the country through a protracted struggle waged for the last 15 years under the leadership of the Southwest Africa People's Organization since its independence, the message hoped everything would go on well in the future.    
 Expressing the belief that the excellent friendly and cooperative relations and solidarity between the two countries would continue to grow stronger in all fields, the message sincerely wished the president and the people of the country greater success in their work for the national unity and prosperity of the country.
